mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Had a short visit with Joe [Seawell] but had to leave his office; regrets that he and Priscilla have been deprived of your society four summers; claims that public politic opinion is disorganized in the North; fears a "dis[solution?] of the Democratic Party Nort and South"; asks Seawell to keep him informed of Virginia politics especially regarding the race between Hunter and Wise. Autograph Letter Signed
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1855 September 5, Robert Tyler, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to Boswell Seawell
